Description: Eight fragments (seven of which are now joined together) of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 11 wine of the Aten domain from the western river.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 8
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393164) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393164)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
